ltc:organisationalUnitName.description: The name of the organisational unit, which is either an institution or a facility (which is always attached to an institution using 'hasParentOrganisationalUnit') or an instrument / service (which is always attached to an facility using 'hasParentOrganisationalUnit')  in the local language.

ltc:description.description: A short text describing the organisational unit.
ltc:description.example: Le muséum national d'histoire naturelle (Paris, France) héberge des collections depuis 400 ans, c'est l'un des plus grands du monde avec près de 68 millions de spécimens conservés.

schema:url.description: The URL of the organisational unit's website (this is not Latimer Core compliant as schema:url is not in the standard).

ltc:hasParentOrganisationalUnit.description: This property refers to one or more related parent instances of the OrganisationalUnit class. In this case, the top Parent will be an institution (topParent)
ltc:hasParentOrganisationalUnit.example: Muséum national d'histoire naturelle, Naturalis Biodiversity center, University of Leiden, Laboratoire d'anatomie comparée
